Package shadowGame

Class TimedEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • shadowGame.TimedEvent
  • public class TimedEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a timed event (timer) class meant to monitor the passing of indexes that increase every .update loop
    Author:
    Daniel Adesina

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TimedEvent​(int range)
      This is a timed event method, creates an event that happens every
      TimedEvent​(int range, int addedOn, boolean random)
      This is a timed event class constructor, this accepts more variables to allow for variety

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void end()
      End method to control the timed event
      void start()
      Start method to control the timed event
      boolean update()
      This is an update method, it is meant to constantly update the timer, once called it will add plus one to the index and if the index has reached the maximum it will return it to zero

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TimedEvent

        public TimedEvent​(int range)
        This is a timed event method, creates an event that happens every
        Parameters:
        range - This decides the range based off an integer that will be pre-selected

      • TimedEvent

        public TimedEvent​(int range,
                  int addedOn,
                  boolean random)
        This is a timed event class constructor, this accepts more variables to allow for variety
        Parameters:
        range - gives it a range as well
        addedOn - added on value to the random number
        random - A random number for the timer

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public boolean update()
        This is an update method, it is meant to constantly update the timer, once called it will add plus one to the index and if the index has reached the maximum it will return it to zero
        Returns:
        If the timer has reached its maximum it will return a boolean value of true, otherwise it will return false

      • start

        public void start()
        Start method to control the timed event

      • end

        public void end()
        End method to control the timed event
